title: How to Add a Picture to a Folder on Mac

steps.title: Double-click the picture you want to use as your folder icon.
steps.content: Double-click the picture you want to use as your folder icon. This opens the picture in Preview.

steps.title: Click the Edit menu and select Copy.
steps.content: Click the Edit menu and select Copy . The picture is now copied to your clipboard.

steps.title: Open Finder on your Mac .
steps.content: Open Finder on your Mac . It's the two-toned smiley face icon on the Dock, which you'll find at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Click the folder you want to change.
steps.content: Click the folder you want to change. This selects the folder. Make sure you just click the folder one time so you don't accidentally open it.

steps.title: Click the File menu and select Get Info.
steps.content: Click the File menu and select Get Info . This opens some information about the folder. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the folder's current icon.
steps.content: Click the folder's current icon. It's in the upper-left area of the window.

steps.title: Click the Edit menu and select Paste.
steps.content: Click the Edit menu and select Paste . Now you'll see the image you copied earlier replace the previous icon. If you want to restore a folder's original icon, just come back to this screen, select the current icon, and then select Edit > Cut .
